video.title: Amazon Alexa Development 101 (full tutorial course - June 2018 version)
video.description:
If you want to start building skills for Amazon Alexa and you're new to programming - this course was created especially for you! By the end of this course, you'll be able to create custom skills for Amazon Alexa - even if you've never written a line of code in your life.

Updated June 2018.

⭐ Course Outline (all in this video) ⭐

⌨ 00:00:05 - Lesson 01: Welcome & Course Introduction
⌨ 00:01:27 - Lesson 02: A Technical Overview of Alexa
⌨ 00:06:03 - Lesson 03: Skills Setup in the Developer Portal
⌨ 00:14:16 - Lesson 04: Skill Service Setup in AWS
⌨ 00:24:24 - Lesson 05: Testing Skill Services
⌨ 00:31:37 - Lesson 06: Utterances, Intents, and Slots
⌨ 00:45:12 - Lesson 07: Using Intents and Slots
⌨ 00:58:41 - Lesson 08: Building Skills on Your Local Computer
⌨ 01:06:27 - Lesson 09: Working with Skill Project Code
⌨ 01:16:20 - Lesson 10: Creating a Complete Skill
⌨ 01:28:22 - Lesson 11: Next Steps

💻 Code, Links, and Resources: https://dabblelab.com/courses/alexa-development-101

🔗 For more Alexa development videos, check out the Dabble Lab channel: https://www.youtube.com/dabblelab

🐦 Creator Steve Tingiris on Twitter: https://twitter.com/tingiris

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

replies.author: Matt Matt
replies.text:
The only thing I want is, something really really simple, well its a simple update, to the amazon alexa app, but I don't know who to talk to, to request/get this update.

My problem is, once you create a routine/routines, you get a list of them.

I currently have over 1000 routines setup, so managing them, can get be a little daunting.

Folder options, would help, so you can put certain type of routines, in one folder, to make it easier to go through them/manage them, but something else that would be even better is, well now, when you click on/into a routine, you can see the toggle switch, to see if the routine is enabled or disabled, but once you click into it, one it could already be disable or enabled, but once you hit the back button, it takes you all the way, back up to the top of your routine list, which is terrible, then you habe to scroll all the way back down, just to get to the routine you were just at.

So adding toggle switches, beside each routine, allowing you to know if their toggled on and off and allowing you to control them, without having to click into them, makes things allot easier/saves allot of time and frustration.

Also another thing that would be nice, is the ability to add multiple, preset routines, togeather/grouping routines, and adding a trigger word, like if you say arm day alarm, alexa will arm the alarm, vs having to open the app and scroll and look for a routine, or also the ability to add multiple triggers, so time could be one, voice word could be another, a certain day could be another, or adding multiple days at different times, anyway, doing these things, could make users less frustrated, and also unlock allot of features/create allot of versatility.

replies.author: Matt Matt
replies.text:
The only thing I want is, something really really simple, well its a simple update, to the amazon alexa app, but I don't know who to talk to, to request/get this update.

My problem is, once you create a routine/routines, you get a list of them.

I currently have over 1000 routines setup, so managing them, can get be a little daunting.

Folder options, would help, so you can put certain type of routines, in one folder, to make it easier to go through them/manage them, but something else that would be even better is, well now, when you click on/into a routine, you can see the toggle switch, to see if the routine is enabled or disabled, but once you click into it, one it could already be disable or enabled, but once you hit the back button, it takes you all the way, back up to the top of your routine list, which is terrible, then you habe to scroll all the way back down, just to get to the routine you were just at.

So adding toggle switches, beside each routine, allowing you to know if their toggled on and off and allowing you to control them, without having to click into them, makes things allot easier/saves allot of time and frustration.

Also another thing that would be nice, is the ability to add multiple, preset routines, togeather/grouping routines, and adding a trigger word, like if you say arm day alarm, alexa will arm the alarm, vs having to open the app and scroll and look for a routine, or also the ability to add multiple triggers, so time could be one, voice word could be another, a certain day could be another, or adding multiple days at different times, anyway, doing these things, could make users less frustrated, and also unlock allot of features/create allot of versatility.
